polished_script:
HOOK: You're not bad at video. You just started in the wrong place. [ON-SCREEN: "You're not bad at video"]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: Most agents buy ring lights and learn editing apps first. Then they wonder why they still freeze on camera every single time. Kim Rittberg â€” six-time Emmy Award-winning marketer who led video strategy at Netflix â€” says you're skipping the most important step. [ON-SCREEN: "6x Emmy Winner â€¢ Netflix Video Strategy"]
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: And this is the part that separates agents who succeed with video from those who quit after three attempts.

INSIGHT: She calls it MSR: Mindset, Skill set, Repetition. Most agents skip straight to skill set. [ON-SCREEN: "MSR: Mindset â†’ Skill Set â†’ Repetition"] They think "I'll feel confident once I'm good at it." Kim says that's completely backwards: "You need to have a mindset shift before you can truly grow with video." [ON-SCREEN: "Mindset shift comes FIRST"] The identity shift happens first â€” you decide you ARE someone who does video. Then you learn the technical skills. Then you repeat until it becomes automatic. Not the other way around.

REFRAME: Think about it â€” you didn't wait to feel like a real estate expert before your first listing appointment. You decided you were an agent, then figured it out as you went. Video works exactly the same way.

CTA: "So here's your homework: record one practice video today where you introduce yourself as 'someone who does video.' Don't post it â€” just say it out loud. Are you going to try this today?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."
